intro: Lamyra riphaea, commonly known as the mountain lamyra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Lamyra riphaea is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions.
